result.execSummary:
The defendant Hailey Marie Weise was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not associate with those who possess illegal controlled substances or alcohol.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. Deft is to sign all releases and follow through with any treatment.
Provide DNA sample and be responsible for the cost.
Deft is to comply with & successfully complete drug Court.

1:47 PM Defendant Hailey Marie Weise in court, in custody at SCDC. Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger in court for Hailey Marie Weise. Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deft advised of rights, plea questionnaire/waiver efiled.
Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgment reviewed.  
Deft enters a Guilty plea on Count 1.
State recommends 3 years probation with conditions including 8mo jail imposed & stayed. 
Defense requests that the Court follow the joint recommendation. 225 days credit.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
Deft makes a statement to the Court. Deft willing to accept Drug Court. 
Court follows joint recommendation; 3 years probation w/mo jail - Stayed.
Deft accepted into Drug Court and is ordered to be equipped with GPS monitoring for 30days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Submitted & Signed Twice.
